text: {{Infobox settlement | official_name = Pregassona | settlement_type = Quarter | native_name = | image_map = Karte Quartier Pregassona 2013.png | image_shield = CHE_Pregassona_COA.svg | image_skyline = Zona popolare lugano.jpg | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = Switzerland | subdivision_type1 = Canton | subdivision_name1 = Ticino | subdivision_type2 = District | subdivision_name2 = Lugano | subdivision_type3 = City | subdivision_name3 = Lugano | area_total_km2 = 2.56 | area_footnotes = | population_as_of = 2014-12-31 | population_total = 9601 | population_footnotes = http://www.lugano.ch/dam/jcr:4bb43ae8-1e90-415b-9e27-325bfe145791/statistica%20popolazione%20di%20Lugano_%2031%20dicembre%202014.pdf | population_density_km2 = auto |coordinates = |utc_offset1 = +1 }} Pregassona is a quarter of the city of Lugano, Switzerland. Until 2004, it was a municipality on its own. Then it was added to Lugano. The name Pregassona comes from a contraction of the local dialect for "near the Cassone"; the Cassone is a small river that flows through the village. == Monuments and places of interest == * Church of Saint Mary, documented since 1222 * Oratory of Saints Peter & Paul, 14th century * Church of Saint John the Baptist and Maximilian Kolbe, 1995 == References == == Other websites == * Official website of the quarter * Lugano Monte Br√® Category:Former municipalities of Ticino Category:Neighbourhoods in Lugano
